intro: Adesmia suffocata, commonly known as the suffocating adesmia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Leguminosae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically trifoliate, meaning they are divided into three leaflets. Adesmia suffocata is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
